definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: Six practical function of living, Special query Voltage and electric quantity, saving power visible.
sentences.chinese: 六大生活实用功能，特设电压电量查询，省电看得见。

sentences.english: Thirdly, Xixia copper in order to increase control iron district money.
sentences.chinese: 其三，西夏为了加大对铜的控制，特设铁钱区。

sentences.english: When my friend Melot set the trap, I think I knew it.
sentences.chinese: 当我的朋友梅洛特设下圈套，我想我是知道的。

sentences.english: A new purpose-built media center will be opened in Beijing tomorrow for overseas  journalists covering China's first spacewalk mission.
sentences.chinese: 明日，本次计划特设媒体中心将在北京建立。

sentences.english: Videotage was founded as a special screening program at Phoenix cine Club.
sentences.chinese: 录映太奇作为一个特设放映项目于火鸟电影会成立。

sentences.english: The coils are of AWG 18 enameled magnet wire, each coil has 50 wraps.
sentences.chinese: 线圈是特设工作组18漆包线电磁线，每圈有50套。

sentences.english: Eight practical function of living, Special query Voltage and electric quantity, saving power visible.
sentences.chinese: 八大生活实用功能，特设电压电量查询，省电看得见。

sentences.english: The norm of non- ad hocness is very important for a successful solution to paradox.
sentences.chinese: 非特设性是衡量一个解悖方案是否成功的重要标志。

sentences.english: The public was even admitted by a sort of lazaretto entrance on the street.
sentences.chinese: 甚至公众也可由一道特设在街旁的大门进往。

definition: (of an organization etc) standing or permanent
to add to existing facilities or services
to set up separately/to establish separate units
to offer (goods or services)/to open (for business etc)
to receive/to be given/to be presented with
to have as its purpose/to be intended to/to aim to (do sth)
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
to create/original creation/to be the first to do sth
located at/set up in a particular location
